sentences.english: Officials say the lion appeared to be starving and was 4- to 5-years-old.
sentences.chinese: 官員稱這頭獅子大約有四五歲，很明顯已經飢腸轆轆。

sentences.english: But the lazy fox went about hungry the whole winter.
sentences.chinese: 而懶惰的狐狸這一冬天都要飢腸轆轆地到處亂竄了。

sentences.english: So the stomachs of the hungry must also compete with fuel tanks.
sentences.chinese: 所以，飢腸轆轆的人們又多了油箱這個競爭對手。

sentences.english: Betty Chinn will never forget what it feels like to be hungry and homeless.
sentences.chinese: 關惠羣永遠不能忘記飢腸轆轆和無家可歸的感覺。

sentences.english: I feel very hungry before lunchtime.
sentences.chinese: 傍午，我就感覺飢腸轆轆了。

sentences.english: That night, the hungry guests sat waiting for the soup.
sentences.chinese: 當晚，飢腸轆轆肚子的客人們都坐着等那碗湯了。

sentences.english: The hungry man heaped up the food on his plate.
sentences.chinese: 這位飢腸轆轆的漢子把食物堆集在自己的盤子裏。

sentences.english: Sometimes he gets hungry and eats like a glutton.
sentences.chinese: 他有時弄得飢腸轆轆且暴食如饕餮。

definition: to eat one's fill/to be full
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
variant of 紓壓|纾压[shu1 ya1]
variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
